description: Statistical avenues for the AI to explore. Add ideas here and the AI will investigate them.

avenues.question: Do numbers currently classified as 'hot' (appeared frequently in last 30 draws) appear at an elevated rate in the NEXT draw?
avenues.details: For each historical draw, classify all 70 numbers as hot/cold/overdue based on the prior 30 draws. Then check: did the winning numbers come from the 'hot' category more than the ~33% baseline would predict? Calculate the hit rate for hot numbers across all draws.

avenues.question: Do 'cold' numbers (appeared rarely in last 30 draws) eventually appear at elevated rates?
avenues.details: Test the gambler's fallacy: when a number hasn't appeared for 30+ draws, does it have a higher probability of appearing in the next 10 draws than baseline? Or does cold stay cold?

avenues.question: Do 'overdue' numbers (longest gap since last appearance) hit at elevated rates?
avenues.details: Track numbers with the longest drought. When a number reaches 50+ draws without appearing, does it appear in the subsequent 20 draws more than random chance? Test if there's a 'correction' effect.

avenues.question: When a number appears 3+ times in 10 draws, does the streak continue?
avenues.details: Identify 'streaking' numbers that have appeared at 3x+ expected rate recently. Do they continue appearing at elevated rates for another 5-10 draws, or does mean reversion kick in immediately?

avenues.question: How long do numbers stay in each category before transitioning?
avenues.details: Track state transitions: hot->neutral->cold->overdue. Is there a predictable duration in each state? Do some numbers cycle faster than others?

avenues.question: Does combining hot+overdue signals improve prediction?
avenues.details: Test if numbers that are BOTH in a recent hot streak AND have a long historical drought show elevated appearance rates. The intersection of recency and historical absence.
